data.title: Task Runner: Alternate version number not accepted in tasks.json
data.body: - VSCode Version: 0.10.11 - OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan Steps to Reproduce: 1. Define a task in `tasks.json` 2. Change the version number to something other than `0.1.0` Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Build errors are not highlighted in editor when performing build operation with CTRL+SHIFT+B
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains .ts file.
2. Setup the task.json and tsconfig.json.
3. Now perform the build operation with CTRL+SHIFT+B
4. Verify output and editor window.

Actual: Getting errors in the output window but there is no red flag in the editor.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14115991/7a6dc8ee-f592-11e5-836a-d856466caff1.png)

data.title: Task Runner: Provide input parameters

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan

I would like to provide input parameters when a task is executed. How can I accomplish this?

The documentation mentions "variable substitution," which is useful, but a browser search for "param" yields nothing.

Cheers,
Trevor Sullivan
Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Task Runner: Define array of tasks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan

The documentation for Task Runners doesn't indicate how to define more than one task in the `tasks.json` file. How do I define more than one? The default `tasks.json` file that gets auto-generated only has one task definition. I tried creating a JSON array, but received error messages about the file format.

Cheers,
Trevor Sullivan
Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Task Runner: Define multiple commands
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan

I would like to be able to specify multiple commands in a Task Runner. Right now, only one command is supported. Is the best way to do this with a shell script?

Cheers,
Trevor Sullivan
Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: TypeScript, mocha, chalk doesn't output color to debug console?
data.body:
In my 0.10.11 version, chalk console logging using chalk works. In the 0.10.12-insider version it doesn't.
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10
- Language: TypeScript 1.8.9, Node 4.1.1, Mocha 2.3.4, 
- Launch: 

```
        {
            "name": "[WP] test",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [
                "test.bundle.js",
                "--no-timeouts",
                "--max_old_space_size=2048",
                "--colors"
            ],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/bin-webpack/test",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [],
            "env": {},
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outDir": "${workspaceRoot}/bin-webpack/test"
        },
```

Steps to Reproduce:
1. `import chalk = require('chalk');`
2. `console.log(chalk.magenta('some text'));`

data.title: Super annoying message, please leave me alone
data.body:
Saw this 3 times today. Please add a leave me alone button.

data.title: Adding language definitions to regular plugins
data.body: Is it possible as it currently sits to add language definition files to normal extensions? For instance Atom has a grammars folder where you can put your syntax files for the languages that your extension adds to the editor. If this isn't currently implemented it would be a nice thing to add

data.title: Perf optimizations
Spanish and French translations mistranslate the spacing in global actions
data.body:
[The string that adds a category to an action label](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/quickopen/browser/commandsHandler.ts#L266) to be displayed in the global command palette is mistranslated by the Spanish and French translations.

**Spanish** - removes the space in front of the `:`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/14111824/84f81c80-f5cc-11e5-8a77-c9d1911b2203.png)

**French** - adds a space before the `:`.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/14111877/c8a493b4-f5cc-11e5-9d14-50cc59c4dc83.png)

data.title: New untitiled file not saved on exit (fixes #4739)
New untitiled file not saved on exit #4739
Tab moves focus needs ux love
data.body:

1. command palette > Toggle use of tab key for setting focus
2. notice red notification in the status bar - I believe we can find a better color for this

Though there should be some contrast since this is an important scenario for accessibility

![screen shot 2016-03-29 at 15 39 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/14109918/a2f53310-f5c4-11e5-94d7-b9ce9ddb4674.png)

data.title: Application insights warnings in console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.13-insider
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open vscode, work a bit on a repo (e.g smoke test)
2. notice application insights warnings in console

@egamma you mentioned that the telemtry seems to be broken, is this related?

![screen shot 2016-03-29 at 15 23 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/14109452/643b9080-f5c2-11e5-8d18-196f4a2619a7.png)

data.title: New untitiled file not saved on exit
data.body:
- OS Version: I see it both on el capitan and linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. file > new file > write some simple content
2. exit vscode - you get a prompt if you want to save, click 'Save' > name the file and sav it inside the repo
3. no changes are visible in repository - vscode is still open, and there is no file that I just saved. I still see the untitiled file open and there is no way for me to save it's content

data.title: [jade] comments have string color

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
1. Open a .jade file (e.g. there is one in our vscode smoke test repo) 
2. Comment out a line - notice the comments are blue or orange (dark theme) which are usually the colors we use for strings
3. I would expect green, the same we use for other languages

This behavior is like this for a while, so I do not think it is important.

data.title: DebugAdapter bin folder not found on path xxx
Visual Studio Code is not responding
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7 - 64 bit
  Commit f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
  Date 2016-03-11T17:10:35.304Z
  Shell 0.35.6
  Renderer 45.0.2454.85
  Node 4.1.1

Steps to Reproduce:
it is produced in many ways one of them:
1. open JavaScript file 
2. type function 
3. press tab
4. the program instance freezes

Please note that I have several instances one of them freezes not all of them together, 
I do not have problem with memory or processing

data.title: Debug stuck when removing breakpoint
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: W10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Insert breakpoint somewhere in the code
2. Start debug
3. Erase breakpoint before it gets to it
4. The debug stops at the erased breakpoint (cannot go forward, it's stuck there). I am sure it stops there because of the logging my code has.

:)

data.title: npm task detection should also detect scripts
data.body:
My test case was the following package.json

``` json
{
  "name": "projections",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "main": "webpack.config.js",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "webpack --config webpack.config.js",
    "dev": "webpack-dev-server --config webpack.config.js --open"
  },
  "author": "waderyan",
  "license": "ISC",
...
```

data.title: Added an image dimensions label underneath the image preview (fixes #3414)
data.body:
Fixes #3414

Added a dimensions label under the image preview:

![Screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/8FFMBrv.png)

As my first submission to **vscode** I've done my best to follow the guidelines laid out, please let me know if anything needs improvement. I was unable to cover this code with tests as I do not believe there are any for `resourceViewer.ts` and couldn't find any that test for rendered output in the view that were applicable.

data.title: C# editor insert space when autoformat instead of tab
data.body:
I already set a setting as `"editor.insertSpaces": false,`

But when I trigger autoformat,type } to close block for example, all tab in that block was convert into 4 space

This only happen to C#
